text:
Hi everyone,

I hope this message finds you well. We are seeking assistance with an issue that has arisen following our transition from using Hapikey (v2 version) to a Private App (v3 version) for our API calls. Since making this change, we have encountered a problem with tracking Google and Facebook leads in our HubSpot contacts list.

Previously, when we used a [specific code], tracking for contacts originating from Google functioned correctly for v2 version. However, after switching to v3 version, the tracking no longer seems to differentiate properly between Google and Facebook leads. Instead, [specific code] appears to aggregate contacts from both sources under a single filter in the HubSpot contacts list, particularly under the "Original source drill-down 2" filter option.

Could you please help us resolve this issue so that we can correctly track and differentiate leads coming from Google and Facebook separately as we did before?

Your prompt attention to this matter would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your help and support.

querying is done using SearchCRM function - there is an endpoint example at the bottom of most objects doc pages on the endpoints tab - below shows the one for companies as an example - maybe the C# examples help, maybe not I don't know about the client for this as I said - in the SearchCRM functions you use the filtering options  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>
Can anyone tell me the correct way of creating a call engagement via HubSpot api?
I am in urgent need
was following HubSpot documentation but it seems to not work\
endpoint `<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/calls>`
Error

:wave: Hello, team! Pretty new here. I’m trying to update contact properties through the tracking code API but it’s not working.

There was a toggle in the past “*Allow tracked events to update contact properties*” for accounts created prior to Sept 2021. My account was created after that, so does this mean it is no longer possible to update contact properties through the tracking code API?

This is the code I’m using:

`_hsq.push(["identify",{`
       `email: {{User e-mail}},`
       `firstname: 'Test Hardcoded',`
       `lastname: {{lastName}},`
       `company: {{accountName}}`
     `}]);`
`_hsq.push(['trackPageView']);`

The contact is created with the email address only if does not exist, but then if a new page view is tracked, the properties are not updated
Thank you in advance

Hello,
I am trying to fetch all properties defined for contacts via `GET /crm/v3/properties/contacts`. But it seems it only returns first 750 properties. Is there any way how to fetch all of them?
You will need to set up a custom field that is a drop down / select property and set them yourself
This is telling you you have an invalid owner id integer. Try switching it to a string, if that doesn’t owrk, then you have an invalid owner ID, meaning the owner Id is not correct
try adding `&limit=1000` to this?
It doesn't make any change…
how many properties do you have?
It' s client's account. They are sure it's over 750 :slightly_smiling_face:
So you don’t know the actual number
Correct. I can try to ask them…
… if it is important…
you can look it up
```<https://app.HubSpot.com/property-settings/{{> hubid }}/properties?type=0-1```
change that out to their hub id
or click settings, properties and then make sure you are on contacts
then it will say how many right there
I just found a portal that has over 1k properties, and it shows all of them
And then some
I don’t believe there is an error with the api
do you agree?
Looks like that… thanks, we will ask them for the exact number and will see.
Thank you!
Hello, i have question i need to take contacts info `email` and `phone_number` by specific pipeline, how it's possible?

Reminder: *Want to be the first to know when a new API is available or an existing API has a new version?*  We publish all of that on our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Developer Changelog>.  While we do our best to avoid <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/breaking-change-definition|breaking changes> to our APIs, sometimes for security, and reliability we have to. The Changelog is where we’ll post announcements ahead of time about it. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Subscribe to the Developer Changelog> to stay up-to-date on what’s happening in the world of HubSpot development.

Hello All,
seeking help, if is there any way in HubSpot that if we add or update the data like certification or badges then it will be trigger some event to sync it to third party system.

Hi all, archiving a property in the interface can be a real pain (the 'used in' column needs to be empty - and this is hard to achieve if users are using those properties in their private views). Is this something that can be done more efficient via the API?
I think `POST /crm/v3/properties/{objectType}/batch/archive` (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties>) is the way…
Thanks!

Hey Guys!
I'm using the API to add objects to lists, but have found that the list says it has 0 contacts while actually having one...
The UI is reporting the same thing.
If anyone knows of any solution I'd be happy to try anything out!
<@U05BQDFF53P> Is this something you are aware of?
You might direct this question in the <#C05T36XTUBF|lists-api-v3> channel.
